We always thought of the ocean as a never-ending supply of food. But recent studies have shown that this is dreadfully untrue. People have always believed that if we replace what we take out by putting more in, that the cycle would continue to work. Over fishing seems to be a big problem in the ocean. For most island Pacifiers, fish is a crucial part of their diet. Kiribati consumption is as high as 200 kg per person annually. The increasingly high demand for fish and other seafoods is causing fishermen to catch more and more frequently. Though, this can be very unhealthy because it can be days, weeks and even months before the fish make it to the market and there is no for sure way to know how or when the fish were caught.
